meanings.definition: To make neat, smart, or trim
meanings.sent1: She spruced up her room before the guests arrived.
meanings.sent2: The gardener spruced the bushes in the park.
meanings.sent3: He always spruced his appearance before going on a date.
meanings.sent4: The interior designer spruced the living room with colorful pillows.
meanings.sent5: The chef spruced the dish with a sprinkle of fresh herbs.

meanings.sent1: The spruced gentleman wore a sharp suit to the event.
meanings.sent2: She looked spruced in her new dress for the party.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked surprisingly spruced after grooming itself.
meanings.sent4: The garden was spruced with flowers in full bloom.
meanings.sent5: The room felt spruced with the addition of a cozy rug.
